quest.name: Rock the Castrum
journal: Raubahn stands ready to commence the penultimate phase of Operation Archon.

* This quest has been adjusted. Please abandon the quest and restart it by speaking to Edelstein at the Ceruleum Processing Plant.

※The Main Scenario Guide shows the next available quest. You can toggle it on and off in Character Configuration, under UI Settings.

You have successfully disabled the magitek field generator protecting the Praetorium, and defeated Livia sas Junius into the bargain. Though you are eager to press on with the fourth and final phase of Operation Archon, you will require the use of an airship if you are to reach the Ultima Weapon's resting place. For now, make your way back outside and report to Raubahn.

After gruffly reaffirming his trust in your abilities, Raubahn declares the third phase of Operation Archon a success. All that remains is the small matter of finding and destroying the Ultima Weapon.
objectives: * This quest has been adjusted. Please abandon the quest and restart it by speaking to Edelstein at the Ceruleum Processing Plant.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Brothers and sisters of the Alliance! I would share with you glad tidings!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Doubtless spurred on by news of the siege of Castrum Oriens, the Maelstrom has struck a double blow! Castrum Occidens and Castrum Marinum are now under blockade!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Phase two of Operation Archon is a success!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Reports tell us that the Garleans offered fierce resistance─but that the Admiral yielded them not one ilm.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: With Occidens, Marinum, and Oriens thus suppressed, the third phase may begin in earnest!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Even as we speak, the Order of the Twin Adder moves to block the railway leading hither from Castrum Centri. And that can mean but one thing...

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: The hour is come to strike at the heart of the Garlean invasion force!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: ...Castrum Meridianum, the den of the Black Wolf!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: My fellow Eorzeans. I am Minfilia, Mistress of the Scions of the Seventh Dawn.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: There exist myriad barriers that divide us─those of race and nation, language and creed, to name but a few.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Such barriers serve to isolate us from our neighbors...yet they also serve to define who we are. Shorn of them, there would be little to distinguish one from another, and the rich variety of our lives would give way to sterile orthodoxy.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: These barriers can never truly be broken down, of course─not so long as there is liberty in the world─but they can be transcended!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Verily, we do so now in coming together for this grand endeavor, to fight side by side in defense of our shared home!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Before me stands the adventurer Forename Surname. You all know herhim as the womanman who will lead the unit tasked with destroying the Ultima Weapon.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We Scions know a different Forename, however. We know herhim as a dear friend who has endured untold hardship on our behalf─a true hero who has ever blazed a path for us to follow. And why do I tell you this? I tell you, friends, because it is time for us to blaze a path for herhim!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Our objective is to wreak such havoc outside the walls of Meridianum as to afford Forename and herhis comrades the time they need to disable the magitek field generator within.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: With the path thus cleared, we may finally turn our minds to the true goal of this operation─the destruction of the Ultima Weapon! All troops, prepare for battle!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I fear I can't accompany you this time. The unenviable task of facilitating communications between our forces has been entrusted to the Ironworks, you see. Know, though, that I will be praying for your safe return.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: See that you come back to us, my friend. May the Crystal bless you and keep you.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: We will suffer the Black Wolf to prowl our lands no more! Let us teach the hunter what it is to be hunted!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Forward, comrades! For Eorzea!

dialogue.name: ALLIEDARMIES
dialogue.text: (-All-)FOR EORZEA!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Go now, Forename, and bring us one step closer to the dawn!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: We will suffer the Black Wolf to prowl our lands no more! Let us teach the hunter what it is to be hunted!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: If I didn't know better, I'd swear you had a personal grudge against magitek armor.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: What can I say? I couldn't bear to let you have all the fun.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Don't worry─Biggs and Wedge have everything in hand. Truth be told, I think they like having the work of three men.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Wedge wasn't exactly pleased to be left behind, though, and made quite sure I knew it. I must say, our recent struggles have done wonders for the lad's spirit.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Given the size of this place, I suspected there might be an armor or three to be had. And here we are.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Hmmm...not as bad as I thought. If I have half Marques's talent for mending things, I should be able to get it working again.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Listen, Forename─we intercepted an imperial communication indicating that the Ultima Weapon is indeed being housed within the Praetorium.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: We also learned that the field which protects the compound is powered by no fewer than three generator towers.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: If you're to deactivate the field, you'll need to locate and disable them all.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: And I'm here to help you do just that.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: See that chute? It leads to waste disposal.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Somewhere nearby, there will be a ceruleum facility supplying fuel to the closest of the three towers.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Find the place and break things.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Go on ahead, Forename. I'll be along as soon as I finish my repairs.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: There you are!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I didn't have the patience to take the long way 'round.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I see you've disabled the first generator. That leaves us with two.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Ah, bugger. That was me, wasn't it?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Well, there's nothing for it but to press on. We must see to the remaining generators before the enemy has the chance to regroup!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: You go on ahead, Forename! I'll bring up the rear!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Let's raise some hell!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Fine work, Forename!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Stand clear. I have a mind to loose some fireworks.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Diverting all power to cannons!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Damn it. There goes the core. I fear I may have overestimated its maximum operating capacity...by a few orders of magnitude. I blame Marques.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Ahem. We'll need to find another way to bring down the third generator.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Well, well...the traitor himself. And with his meddlesome friend for company.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: You go on ahead, Forename. I need to get to the bottom of something.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: It's me! Are you all right!?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: That's an assault craft you're up against! You don't stand a chance with conventional weapons!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: You're going to need something big to bring it down. A mortar, a cannon─anything!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Hold on, Forename! I'm on my way!

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: Fools! If you are resolved to die here, you might at least have done so without first making a mess of the place!

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: I see that Garlond is not with you. More's the pity, I had hoped to slay him myself. But never mind the traitor for now.

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: I have so looked forward to this meeting...Forename Surname.

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: Yes, I know much and more about you. About your strength...and your hidden talents.

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: I would sample them firsthand─and you will indulge me.

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: My lord was quite taken with you and the power you possess─the “Echo.” Naturally, I could not help but wonder whom this princess among womenprince among men might be...

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: Only to discover that you are but another adventurer. No better than the multitude.

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: Yet in spite of this, the masses hold you their champion, and shower honors upon your head. It defies all reason.

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: How is it that you could be such a thorn in our side? Wherever you appear, you leave havoc in your wake. You even slew Rhitahtyn, one of our very finest.

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: Well...I will not speculate. Truth be told, I couldn't care less how you have done these things. What matters to me is the fact that you have done them.

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: If you are allowed to continue, you will eventually deprive me of all that I have toiled for─all that is mine by right!

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: My minions, my comrades...even my lord Gaius!

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: Well, you cannot have him!

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: His dreams and ambitions, his body and soul─they are mine, do you hear me!? All mine!

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: I lost everything once before! I will not suffer it to happen again!

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: I will kill you, adventurer! Only your death can bring me peace!

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: No... <sob> It's happening...all over again...

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: Please... I cannot bear it... <sob> Don't take him...away from me...

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: My lord Gaius!!!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Another poor fool who craved Gaius's affection over all else... May her soul know rest.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: 'Tis a miracle no harm has come to you, my friend. One for which I will happily give thanks.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: And thanks to your fine diversionary work, we've succeeded in bringing down the generator tower─and with it, the magitek field!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: The way to the Praetorium now lies open. The only problem is, we can't reach it on foot.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Nay, we'll need to take the Enterprise. I left her at the Ceruleum Processing Plant, so let's regroup there.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: This is it, Forename! The final confrontation awaits!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I knew you wouldn't let us down, soldier!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: With the Praetorium stripped of its defenses, the way to the Ultima Weapon lies open.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: The time is come for the final phase of Operation Archon!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Go now, Forename, and bring us one step closer to the dawn!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: See that you come back to us, my friend. May the Crystal bless you and keep you.
